greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Product_{k>=0} (1 - 1/(2*6^k)).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..2000
formula: lim inf product{0<=k<=floor(log_6(n)), floor(n/6^k)*6^k/n} for n-->oo.
Equals (1/2)*(1/12; 1/6)_{infinity}, where (a;q)_{infinity} is the q-Pochhammer symbol. - _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 20 2015
mathematica: digits = 103; NProduct[1-1/(2*6^k), {k, 0, Infinity}, NProductFactors -> 200, WorkingPrecision -> digits+5] // N[#, digits+5]& // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 18 2014 *)
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Aug 14 2007
